com.google.code.gtkjfilechooser

Class GettextResource

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.ResourceBundle
      • com.google.code.gtkjfilechooser.GettextResource

  • public class GettextResource
extends java.util.ResourceBundle

    Read and use .mo files for internationalization.

    The .mo file format is described here . Other useful information are in the gettext tutorial
    Author:
    Costantino Cerbo

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.util.ResourceBundle

      • CONTEXT_SPECIFIER

        private static byte CONTEXT_SPECIFIER
        There are entries with a context specifier, for example: 
         msgid "paper size|Invoice"
 msgstr "Fattura"
        The text before the specifier hasn't to be translated.

      • useContextSpecifier

        private boolean useContextSpecifier
        This flag becomes true when a byte with value 0x04 is found.

      • msgidByteBuffers

        private java.nio.ByteBuffer[] msgidByteBuffers
        Array of the byte buffers for each msgid. We use byte buffers, because we map regions of the file channel into memory.

      • msgstrByteBuffers

        private java.nio.ByteBuffer[] msgstrByteBuffers
        Array of the byte buffers for each msgstr. We use byte buffers, because we map regions of the file channel into memory.

      • setCharset

        private void setCharset()
        Usually the info message in a .mo file contais also the charset info, for example: 
         Project-Id-Version: gtk+ 2.14
 Report-Msgid-Bugs-To: 
 POT-Creation-Date: 2009-08-29 00:06-0400
 PO-Revision-Date: 2009-04-17 22:57+0200
 Last-Translator: Luca Ferretti <elle.uca@libero.it>
 Language-Team: Italian <tp@lists.linux.it>
 MIME-Version: 1.0
 Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8
 Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit
 Plural-Forms: nplurals=2; plural=(n != 1);

      • getCharset

        public java.nio.charset.Charset getCharset()

      • readOffsetsAndLenghts

        private void readOffsetsAndLenghts(java.io.File file)
        Read the offset and length for each original and translated string. This information are stored in the arrays: oo_offset, oo_length, tt_offset and tt_length. This method read sequentially the first h bytes in the .mo file. Then we use access the file random using a FileChannel and mapping the just found positions.

              int index)

        Returns:

      • releaseOffsetAndLenghtArrays

      • handleGetObject

        protected java.lang.Object handleGetObject(java.lang.String key)
        Note that we don't throw a MissingResourceException when no translation is found. In the GNU gettext approach, the gettext function returns the (English) message key in that case.
        Specified by:
        handleGetObject in class java.util.ResourceBundle

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String... args)
        Command line user interface. 
         Usage: gettextResource [-k MSGID] FILENAME
 
 Get the translation for the given MSGID or list all
 MSGID/MGSSTR pairs when no option is given.
 
 Options:
   -h, --help            Show this help message and exit
   -k MSGID              Get the associated msgstr
 
 
 Examples:
   gettextResource -k Search /usr/share/locale/it/LC_MESSAGES/gtk20.mo
   gettextResource /usr/share/locale/it/LC_MESSAGES/gtk20.mo
